item.title: A pothole in road problem, 8th April
item.description:
Customer reports multiple potholes within the first 3 yards at the location. Some are around 80mm deep and around a foot in diameter it's "Like a ploughed field". They advise that previous repairs have been fruitless.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags of builders sand on pavement, 8th April
item.description:
There are 4 bags of builders sand (?)on the pavement outside 51 Marle Hill Parade. They have been there for some time now and are starting to split.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Marle Hill Parade, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 18 inch potholeS as you turn left onto Folland Avenue from near Hucclecote Road, 7th April
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Folland Avenue, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury

item.title: Large enough to cause someone to go over near the road, 7th April
item.description:
Part of a drop kerb between no 10-14 looked like a repair patch from when a utility company has had already done some work in the past which has crumbled away as I was working for ubico collecting the recycling as I stepped away from the lorry I went over and damaged my ankle

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Naunton Way, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Princess Elizabeth way, 7th April
item.description:
The cycle path between Yellow Self Storage Unit Place and Coronation Square â€“ the whole cycle path between there â€“ is uneven; in some places the path is raised, and I almost fell off my bike twice, and I fell off my scooter the other day because of the uneven cycle path.This foot path was in this bad state for years and never been fixed and repaired
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
